title: Fatality numbers from heat waves and cold waves in the U.S.from 1900 to 2016
summary: The Fatality numbers Type, in the heat waves was Type, Heat_wave_1995_Missouri_Oklahoma_Illinois , who made 1260 fatalities .

In second place was Type, Heat_wave_1936_Illinois with 1193 fatalities ; third place went to Type, Heat_wave_1980_Kansas_City_Missouri_St_Loius with 1260 fatalities ; fourth place went to Type, Heat_wave_2012_Washington_DC_Iowa_Virginia_North_Carolina with 107 fatalities and fifth place went to Type, Heat_wave_1999_Illinois_Missouri_Wisconsin , who was 257 fatalities .

gold: This statistic shows a list of heat waves and cold waves experienced in the United States from 1900 to 2016 , by the number of fatalities that occurred as a result . In the deadliest event on record , around 1,260 people lost their lives as a result of a heat wave in 1980 in Missouri and Tennessee .
